author: Laurel Perry
comment: Is showing me tweets at least twice an hour with refresh set at every three? What am I missing? Great app. Asus zenwatch 2 with Samsung 6 marshmallow here. Edited: it settled down nicely. Terrific support. Love it.

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Thank you for your review! That sounds odd, I'll have a look if I can. :)

title: Great but...

comment: This is App is very good, the only thing missing is the multiple twitter account option. Or am I missing something?

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Nope, it's one account only at the moment. Thanks for the feedback!

title: Very Good

author: Jon Johnson
comment: Does just what I was looking for. Tweets quick. Would like option to disable retrieving of tweets altogether though. I don't care to read tweets on my watch. Downloaded specifically to tweet from it.

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Thank you for your feedback! It is a valid suggestion I have never thought about. Have you tried blocking the app on the rightmost notification action? That might help.

title: Great

author: Rodie Schement
comment: Perfect app, thanks for adding the vibration option!

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content:
EDIT: Thanks for the suggestion! ;)

Thank you for your feedback! Good idea, I'll add your request to the to do list.

title: Awesome

author: Jeff Haagenstad
comment: Would it be possible to only send tweets from specific people to the Wear device? I follow a lot of people / companies but I don't necessarily want to see their tweets. If There was a list on the Phone where I could check or uncheck the people I wanted to send to the watch it would be perfect for me!

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Thank you! You can now select Twitter Lists, not just the Timeline so if you create a List on Twitter with the people you want to receive notifications from, then you can now select it in the app. Hope this helps.

title: Works very well

author: Luke Rodriguez
comment: Interesting take on Twitter for wear.  I actually quite like it not being a standalone app that I have to launch.. Though it did confuse me at first.  It's there anyway to have images show up in time line?

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Thank you for the review! Inline images probably won't work but I have something in mind on how to show them in a future release.

title: Nice

author: Tim Jenkins
comment: Great idea but it keeps crashing on my phone.   This may be due to the preview version of Android L I am using

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content:
EDIT: Do you still have issues with app? Can you update your rating please?
--
Thank you for your feedback! I'll 
update the app shortly to prevent the background service from crashing.

title: Crashes

author: Tony Jeffreys
comment: It's good to be able to get tweets on my watch :-) . It does seem that previous tweets are displayed though - can this be changed so that only new tweets are displayed?

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Thank you! It's a good idea, I will make it in a future release.

title: Great app!

author: James Bricknell
comment: This is a great start to a helpful app. Well done
title: Great start.

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Thank you! I'm glad you like it.

author: Ian Morley
comment: Maybe you could add customized notifications? Example: Option to only be notified if you were mentioned or if your tweet was favorite or retweeted.

reply.author: Viktor Adam
reply.content: Thanks! It's a good idea, I'll see what I can do. :)

title: Has potential.
